data.title: Celebrity deaths 2024: Actors, singers and stars we lost this year
data.meta_description: Hollywood is mourning the loss of some of its finest stars. Page Six remembers the actors, singers and more celebs who died in 2024.
data.text:
Hollywood is mourning the loss of some of its finest stars.

Below, Page Six remembers the actors, singers and more celebs who died in 2024.

Phil Donahue

Trailblazing talk show host Phil Donahue passed away peacefully at home in August after a long illness, his family announced. He was 88.

The eponymous talk show host is survived by his wife of 44 years, Marlo Thomas, and his children.

John Aprea

John Aprea died at age 83 from natural causes on Aug. 7, his manager, Will Levine, told TMZ.

The â€œGodfather Part IIâ€ star, known for his role as young Salvatore Tessi in the 1974 blockbuster, passed away at his Los Angeles home surrounded by his family.

Aprea also appeared in â€œFull Houseâ€ playing the father of John Stamosâ€™ character, Jesse Katsopolis.

BeatKing

BeatKing, a popular rapper from Houston whose real name was Justin Riley, died on Aug. 15. He was 39.

â€œBeatKing has been the best part of the club for over a decade. He has produced and worked with so many artists, that his sound will forever live,â€ his manager, Tasha Felder, wrote on Instagram while announcing the news.

â€œHe loved his daughters @clubgodparenting, his music and his fans. We will love him forever.â€

A cause of death was not immediately revealed.

Gena Rowlands

â€œThe Notebookâ€ star Gena Rowlands died at the age of 94 after battling Alzheimerâ€™s disease.

According to TMZ, the retired actress passed away on Aug. 14 at her home in Indian Wells, Calif., where she was surrounded by her husband, Robert Forrest, and her daughter Alexandra â€œXanâ€ Cassavetes.

The outlet reported that Rowlandsâ€™ son, Nick Cassavetes â€” who directed the 2004 movie â€” had paid her frequent visits earlier in the week.

Itâ€™s unclear whether Rowlandsâ€™ other daughter, Zoe Cassavetes, was there when she died.

Though her cause of death has not been shared, Nick revealed his motherâ€™s Alzheimerâ€™s diagnosis in June while celebrating the 20th anniversary of â€œThe Notebook,â€ in which her character, Allie, develops the progressive disease that destroys memory and other important mental functions.

â€œSheâ€™s in full dementia, and itâ€™s so crazy â€” we lived it, she acted it and now itâ€™s on us,â€ he shared at the time.

Richard Lugner

Austrian entrepreneur Richard Lugner died on Aug. 12 in his home in Vienna at the age of 91 â€” just two months after marrying his sixth wife.

First responders were reportedly called to his mansion but were unable to revive him.

The billionaire construction tycoon, known for hosting his annual star-studded Vienna Opera Ball, married Simone ReilÃ¤nder two months prior to his passing.

He had battled several health issues including prostate cancer, skin cancer, and more recently, a ruptured heart valve.

Connie Chiume

Connie Chiume, best known for appearing in â€œBlack Pantherâ€ and â€œBlack Panther: Wakanda Forever,â€ died on Tuesday, August 6 at 71.

She passed unexpectedly at a hospital in Johannesburg, South Africa, her son, Nongelo Chiume, told South African news network Newzroom Afrika.

â€œShe was admitted for a medical procedure and she was recovering well. But, unfortunately, we then got the news of her passing,â€ he said.

He added, â€œWe are proud to be her children. She left us a beautiful legacy, not only just for her children or her family â€” but for the community and the country at large.â€

Hailey Merkt

Hailey Merkt, who competed on â€œThe Bachelorâ€ Season 21, died after a battle with leukemia. She was 31.

â€œIt is with shattered hearts I convey that our dear darling Hailey passed on Friday, July 26,â€ her family shared via her GoFunMe page.

â€œAfter the bone marrow transplant had taken, she was told she had nine months to not even think about cancer, but in truth she only had 6 weeks before she got the terrible news that leukemia cells were back and moving fast.

â€œHer first reaction was to say, â€˜â€â€˜I donâ€™t care about myself anymore, but I canâ€™t bear being the cause of so much pain for the people I love.'â€

Kim Johnson

Kim Johnsonâ€™s daughter, Kerry Johnson Tichi, announced her death on July 29. The â€œSurvivor: Africaâ€ star was 79.

â€œOur mom leaves a legacy of strength, resilience, kindness and generosity,â€ Tichi said in a statement.

â€œShe wore her rose colorized glasses right up until the end,â€ she continued. â€œShe was the coolest mom and grandmother in the world. We will miss her foreverâ€¦â€

Other â€œSurvivorâ€ stars such as Ethan Zohn, Yam Yam Arocho and host Jeff Probst also mourned the loss online.

The Nelons

Three family members from the Grammy-nominated gospel group The Nelons died in a plane crash on Friday.

The groupâ€™s management company Gaither Music shared the news on Facebook. In a lengthy statement, they revealed that Kelly Nelon Clark, her husband, Jason Nelon Clark, and daughter, Amber Nelon Kistler, were killed in the crash.

Amberâ€™s husband, Nathan Kistler, their assistant, Melodi Hodges, the pilot, Larry Haynie, and his wife, Melissa, also died.

However, the groupâ€™s fourth member â€” Kellyâ€™s younger daughter, Autumn Nelon Streetman â€” was not on the Pilatus PC-12/47E aircraft at the time of the fatal crash.

Esta TerBlanche

Actress Esta TerBlanche has died. She was 51.

The â€œAll My Childrenâ€ alum was found dead at her West Hollywood, Calif., home, her goddaughter told TMZ on July 21.

According to the outlet, TerBlanche likely died a day before her body was found.

Her publicist, Lisa Rodrigo, claimed the former pageant queen passed away from natural causes.

Autumn Crittendon

â€œ16 & Pregnantâ€ alum Autumn Crittendon, who appeared on Season 5 of the MTV series, has died.

She was 27 and leaves behind three young children.

A rep from the Henrico County Police Department in Virginia told Page Six in a statement that she died at home after being found â€œunresponsiveâ€ on July 20.

Weâ€™re told paramedics â€œattempted life-saving measuresâ€ but that â€œthey were not effective.â€

Crittendon, whose legal last name was Oxley, â€œwas pronounced dead at the scene,â€ weâ€™re told.

Weâ€™re told the police department is â€œcurrently classifying this incident as a death investigationâ€ and that â€œdetectives are working with the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner on this case to determine the exact cause and manner of death.â€

Christina Sandera

Clint Eastwood revealed on July 19 that his longtime partner, Christina Sandera, had died at age 61.

â€œChristina was a lovely, caring woman, and I will miss her very much,â€ the actor wrote in a statement to The Hollywood Reporter.

The couple had been an item since 2014.

Bob Newhart

Beloved comedian Bob Newhart died at his Los Angeles home on July 18. He was 94.

Newhart was best known for his deadpan humor while starring in CBSâ€™s â€œThe Bob Newhart Showâ€ from 1972 to 1978 followed by â€œNewhart,â€ which ran from 1982 to 1990.

The â€œElfâ€ actorâ€™s death came one year after his wife, Ginnie, died at age 82.

â€œShe was our rock and we miss her terribly,â€ Newhart said at the time.

Bella Brave

TikTok star Bella Brave died in July after a brave battle with various ailments, including the rare bowel disorder Hirschsprungâ€™s disease.

â€œBella passed peacefully in our arms,â€ Bellaâ€™s mom announced on social media. â€œPlease keep her name on your lips, her memories alive and her bravery in your hearts. Please share with us every detail of how she touched your life or kept you brave.â€

Shannen Doherty

â€œBeverly Hills, 90210â€³ actress Shannen Doherty died after a lengthy battle with stage 4 cancer. She was 53.

â€œIt is with a heavy heart that I confirm the passing of actress Shannen Doherty. On Saturday, July 13, she lost her battle with cancer after many years of fighting the disease,â€ her longtime publicist, Leslie Sloane, told People in a statement.

â€œThe devoted daughter, sister, aunt and friend was surrounded by her loved ones as well as her dog, Bowie. The family asks for their privacy at this time so they can grieve in peace,â€ Sloane continued.

Richard Simmons

Iconic fitness instructor Richard Simmons died, according to multiple reports, on July 13.

He died at the age of 76 just hours after he thanked fans for their birthday wishes.

According to ABC News, his housekeeper found him dead and called 911. No foul play was suspected.

Dr. Ruth Westheimer

Dr. Ruth Westheimer died at age 96 on July 12.

Her rep confirmed the news to Page Six at the time, saying she â€œdied peacefully, at home, holding the hands of her son and daughter.â€

The famed sex therapist and radio host was born in Germany and came to America in the â€™50s.

After getting her doctorate from Columbia University, she shot to fame with her sex radio show and subsequent lectures on sex and sexuality.

Shelley Duvall

â€œThe Shiningâ€ star Shelley Duvall died at age 75 on July 11.

Dan Gilroy, Duvallâ€™s partner since 1989 confirmed she died in her sleep at her home in Blanco, Texas, due to complications from diabetes.

Duvall landed her breakthrough role in Altmanâ€™s cult film â€œNashville,â€ which was released in 1975. She went on to star in her two most famous films â€œThe Shiningâ€ and â€œPopeyeâ€ in 1980.

Benji Gregory

Benji Gregory, best known for playing Brian Tanner as a child on the 1980s sitcom â€œALF,â€ died in June.

He was found deceased in his car at a Chase Bank parking lot in Peoria, Ariz. on June 13, according to TMZ.

The body of his service dog, Hans, was also found with him. Gregory was 46 when he passed.

Pat Colbert

Pat Colbert, best known for her work on â€œLeonard Part 6â€ and â€œDallas,â€ has died. She was 77.

The actressâ€™s sister Tami Colbert told the Hollywood Reporter on July 9 that Pat died on June 23 at her home in Compton, Calif.

Jon Landau

The Oscar-winning â€œTitanicâ€ and â€œAvatarâ€ producer Jon Landau died at age 63 in July.

A cause of death was not released at the time.

â€œJon was a visionary whose extraordinary talent and passion brought some of the most unforgettable stories to life on the big screen. His remarkable contributions to the film industry have left an indelible mark, and he will be profoundly missed,â€ Alan Bergman, Disney Entertainment co-chairman, said in a statement.

Bergman added, â€œHe was an iconic and successful producer yet an even better person and a true force of nature who inspired all around him.â€

Dawn Hollyoak

Dawn Hollyoakâ€™s death was announced via Instagram on July 5. She was 61.

â€œItâ€™s with a heavy heart we announce the passing of our star ğŸŒŸ baker Dawn,â€ a statement on the former â€œGreat British Bake Offâ€ contestantâ€™s profile read.

â€œNot only a wonderfully talented baker but first and foremost an amazing mother, grandmother, wife and friend. Dawn passed away peacefully surrounded by her family.â€

A cause of death was not immediately revealed.

Mike Heslin

Mike Heslin died on July 2 after going into cardiac arrest, his husband, Scotty Dynamo, announced via Instagram. The â€œSpecial Ops: Lionessâ€ actor was 30.

â€œMichael was young, in perfect health, and the doctors have no explanation for what happened,â€ Dynamo added in his statement.

Keke Jabbar

Keke Jabbar, who rose to fame as a star in OWNâ€™s â€œLove & Marriage: Hunstville,â€ has died. The reality tv star was 42.

Blogger Marcella Speaks first reported the news on a YouTube Livestream on July 2 with a statement from Jabbarâ€™s family who said she died â€œpeacefully at home surrounded by love.â€

Jabbarâ€™s co-star and cousin, LaTisha Scott, also commented on the loss telling her followers, â€œAt this time we are asking for respect, and privacy in our moment of grief, while we process this great loss!â€

â€œThis is hard for our Family!!!!!â€ Scott said.

Andrew Jury

Andrew Jury, who starred in New Zealandâ€™s first season of â€œMarried at First Sight,â€ was found dead in jail on June 27.

Juryâ€™s father told the New Zealand Herald that his son was â€œstrugglingâ€ with his mental health while on remand at Mt Eden Corrections Facility in Auckland, New Zealand.

Jury was scheduled for a hearing just hours before his death on charges of assault with intent to injure, wilful damage and possession of an offensive weapon.

Officers told the Herald there was no â€œsuspiciousâ€ activity surrounding his death.

Martin Mull

Martin Mull, who was best known for his work on â€œRoseanneâ€ died on June 27, following a long illness. The actor was 80 when he passed away at his home, his rep, Jennifer Craig, told TMZ.

The longtime actor played Leon Carp in 46 episodes of â€œRoseanne.â€ He was also a series regular on â€œSabrina the Teenage Witch,â€ and had a recurring role on â€œTwo and a Half Men.â€

On the big screen, he is best known for playing Colonel Mustard in 1985â€™s â€œClue.â€ He also had roles in â€œJingle All The Wayâ€ with Arnold Schwarzenegger and â€œMr. Mom.â€

Bill Cobbs

Veteran actor Bill Cobbs died at age 90 on June 25, 2024 at his home in Riverside, Calif.

His publicist confirmed the news at the time, though they did not release a cause of death.

Cobbs had roles in hits like â€œThe Bodyguard,â€ â€œThe Hitter,â€ â€œNight at the Museumâ€ and many more. He also appeared in episodes of TV shows including â€œThe Sopranosâ€ and â€œWalker, Texas Ranger.â€

Shifty Shellshock

Crazy Townâ€™s Shifty Shellshock passed away on June 24, the Los Angeles Medical Examiner announced. A cause of death wasnâ€™t immediately given, though the â€œButterflyâ€ crooner, whose real name was Seth Binzer, struggled with substance abuse.

Just two months ago, the performer posted on Instagram that he was â€œgratefulâ€ to be sober.

Julio Foolio

Rapper Julio Foolio died after allegedly being â€œambushedâ€ in the parking lot of a Holiday Inn in Tampa, Fla., on June 23.

According to News4JAX, he was allegedly shot and succumbed to his injuries.

The hitmaker celebrated his 26th birthday a few days before.

Donald Sutherland

Beloved actor Donald Sutherland died in June 2024, his son Kiefer Sutherland announced on X.

â€œWith a heavy heart, I tell you that my father, Donald Sutherland, has passed away,â€ Kiefer wrote on June 20. â€œI personally think one of the most important actors in the history of film.

â€œNever daunted by a role, good, bad or ugly. He loved what he did and did what he loved, and one can never ask for more than that. A life well lived.â€

The â€œHunger Gamesâ€ actor was 88.

Willie Mays

Willie Mays, widely considered to be one of the greatest baseball players in history, died on June 18. He was 93.

â€œIt is with great sadness that we announce that San Francisco Giants Legend and Hall of Famer Willie Mays passed away peacefully this afternoon at the age of 93,â€ the San Francisco Giants tweeted on X announcing the news on behalf of Maysâ€™ family.

Mays signed with Major League Baseballâ€™s New York Giants after high school graduation and won Rookie of the Year his first season. He was named the National League MVP twice and was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1979.

Jerry West

Jerry West, former Los Angeles Lakers star who is the face of the NBA logo, died at age 86 on June 12.

â€œJerry West, the personification of basketball excellence and a friend to all who knew him, passed away peacefully this morning at the age of 86. His wife, Karen, was by his side,â€ read a statement from the Los Angeles Clippers.

West played 14 seasons for the Lakers and led the team to nine appearances in the NBA finals, winning the title once in 1972.

A cause of death was not disclosed.

Enchanting

Rapper Enchanting died on June 11 after she was placed on life support following an overdose, per the Daily Mail. She was 26.

â€œShe came to my house the last four days to get clean,â€ a rep from the musician told the Shade Room, according to the outlet. â€œShe tried her best and I did everything I could to help her, she tried.â€

The Texas-based artist â€” born Channing Nicole Larry â€” started in the music industry after high school when she signed with Gucci Maneâ€™s 1017 label.

Aside from music, Enchanting was also an OnlyFans model.

Johnny Wactor

â€œGeneral Hospitalâ€ actor Johnny Wactor died after being shot during a robbery attempt in downtown Los Angeles. He was 37.

Wactorâ€™s mother, Scarlett, told TMZ that he was killed early May 25 after he and a colleague allegedly caught three suspects trying to steal a catalytic converter from his car.

The actor was fatally shot when he confronted them, even though authorities told his mother that he did not put up a fight.

The actor is survived by his mother and his brothers, Lance and Grant.

Albert S. Ruddy

Movie producer Albert S. Ruddy died on May 25. He was 94.

His family said he succumbed to a brief illness at the Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center in Los Angeles.

Ruddy won two Oscars for best picture for 1972â€™s â€œThe Godfatherâ€ and 2004â€™s â€œMillion Dollar Baby.â€ He also co-created the CBS sitcom â€œHoganâ€™s Heroes,â€ which aired from 1965 to 1971.

Bill Walton

Former NBA MVP Bill Walton, who became a legendary broadcaster later in life, died on May 27 following a cancer battle. He was 71.

â€œBill Walton was truly one of a kind,â€ NBA commissioner Adam Silver said in a statement at the time.

â€œI treasured our close friendship, envied his boundless energy and admired the time he took with every person he encountered.â€

Morgan Spurlock

â€œSuper Size Meâ€ director Morgan Spurlock died on May 23 from cancer-related complications. He was 53.

â€œIt was a sad day, as we said goodbye to my brother Morgan,â€ Craig Spurlock, who worked with his sibling on several projects, said in a statement to Variety.

â€œMorgan gave so much through his art, ideas and generosity. Today the world has lost a true creative genius and a special man. I am so proud to have worked together with him.â€

Dabney Coleman

Hollywood icon Dabney Coleman died at the age of 92 on May 16.

At the time, his daughter Quincy told us the actor â€œtook his last earthly breath peacefully and exquisitelyâ€ at his home in Santa Monica.

â€œMy father crafted his time here on earth with a curious mind, a generous heart, and a soul on fire with passion, desire and humor that tickled the funny bone of humanity,â€ she said. â€œAs he lived, he moved through this final act of his life with elegance, excellence and mastery.â€

â€œA teacher, a hero, and a king, Dabney Coleman is a gift and blessing in life and in death as his spirit will shine through his work, his loved ones and his legacyâ€¦eternally.â€

Coleman was best known for his roles in â€œ9 to 5,â€ â€œTootsie,â€ â€œYouâ€™ve Got Mailâ€ and more.

Mandisa

â€œAmerican Idolâ€ alum Mandisa passed away on April 18, Christian rock radio station K-Love announced. She was 47.

The â€œOvercomerâ€ singer died at home in Nashville, Tenn., and although no cause of death was given, the radio stationâ€™s chief media officer said the struggles she faced from a traumatized past were â€œover.â€

Kyle Marisa Roth

Popular celebrity gossip TikToker Kyle Marisa Roth died in April at age 36, her family shared.

â€œMy daughter Kyle has passed away. She touched some of your lives personally and some of your lives via her immense life on another platform,â€ her mother, Jacquie Cohen Roth, wrote on LinkedIn.

â€œKyle loved and lived fiercely. Nothing makes sense now and weâ€™ll understand more in the next few days. Be kind to one another please,â€ she continued.

Her cause of death is currently unknown.

OJ Simpson

OJ Simpson â€œsuccumbed to his battle to cancerâ€ on April 10 at age 76.

â€œHe was surrounded by his children and grandchildren,â€ read the statement posted to his X account on April 11. â€œDuring this time of transition, his family asks that you please respect their wishes for privacy and grace.â€

Simpson played 11 seasons in the NFL but was best known for his 1995 acquittal after standing trial for the murder of ex-wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ron Goldman.

C.J. Snare

FireHouse lead singer C.J. Snare died on April 5 from cardiac arrest, his daughter, Heather, told TMZ. He was 64.

His surviving bandmates took to Facebook to mourn his death, writing, â€œToday is a sad day for Rock N Roll.â€

They continued, â€œCJ was expected to be back on stage with the band this summer after recovering from surgery. We are all in complete shock with CJâ€™s untimely passing.â€

Leading up to his death, Snare was also battling cancer.

Cole Brings Plenty

â€œ1923â€ actor Cole Brings Plenty was found dead in a wooded area of Kansas on April 5.

He was located after he had been reported missing and declared the suspect of a domestic violence case days earlier.

He was 27.

Chance Perdomo

â€œGen Vâ€ star Chance Perdomo died March 30 at age 27 â€œas a result of a motorcycle accident,â€ according to his publicist.

â€œIt is with heavy hearts that we share the news of Chance Perdomoâ€™s untimely passing as a result of a motorcycle accident,â€ the rep told Variety.

â€œAuthorities have advised that no other individuals were involved. His passion for the arts and insatiable appetite for life was felt by all who knew him, and his warmth will carry on in those who he loved dearest.â€

Perdomo earned a BAFTA nomination for best actor in a leading role for his role as Jerome Rogers in the 2018 TV movie â€œKilled by My Debt.â€

In â€œGen V,â€ the British-American actor played Andre Anderson, a student at Godolkin University who has magnetic manipulation abilities.

M. Emmet Walsh

M. Emmet Walsh, who appeared in â€œBlade Runnerâ€ and â€œKnives Out,â€ died at the age of 88 on March 19.

Walshâ€™s long-time manager, Sandy Joseph, told Entertainment Tonight that the actor died from cardiac arrest at a hospital in Vermont.

Walsh appeared in 119 films and 250 television productions throughout his decades-long career, which began in 1969.

Robyn Bernard

Robyn Bernard â€” famous for her work on â€œGeneral Hospitalâ€ â€” was pronounced dead on March 12, according to TMZ.

The actressâ€™ body was found in the town of San Jacinto, CA. Riverside County Coroner told TMZ they identified Bernard by using her fingerprints.

No cause of death has been determined yet, but an autopsy is scheduled to be performed in the near future.

Bernard, who was 64 at the time of her death, had small parts in â€™80s TV shows like â€œDiva,â€ â€œThe Facts Of Life,â€ â€œSimon & Simon,â€ and â€œTour of Duty,â€ before getting her big break in 1984 on â€œGeneral Hospital.â€

She played Terry Brock for 145 episodes until 1990.

Leah Smith

TikToker Leah Smith died from stage 4 bone cancer on March 11. She was 22.

â€œWeâ€™ll all miss Leah but weâ€™ll make sure that we never forget her,â€ her boyfriend, Andrew, said in a statement shared on her TikTok page.

Smith began documenting her journey with cancer on social media in 2019. She amassed 525,000 followers.

Steve Lawrence

Steve Lawrence, who rose to fame in the â€™50s in the musical duo Steve & Eydie with his wife, Eydie GormÃ©, died on March 7.

â€œMy Dad was an inspiration to so many people. But, to me, he was just this charming, handsome, hysterically funny guy who sang a lot. Sometimes alone and sometimes with his insanely talented wife,â€ his son, David Lawrence, said in a statement on March 7.

He died of Alzheimerâ€™s-related issues. He was 88 years old.

Garrison Brown

â€œSister Wivesâ€ stars Janelle and Kody Brownâ€™s son Garrison died in an apparent suicide on March 5. He was 25.

The Flagstaff Police Department told TMZ that Garrison died at his home in Arizona, where he had been living on his own after moving away from his family. Police told the outlet that he was dead at the scene when they arrived, adding that he appeared to have suffered a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

Janelle later took to Instagram to confirm the news of her loss.

â€œKody and I are deeply saddened to announce the loss of our beautiful boy Robert Garrison Brown,â€ she wrote alongside two photos of Garrison.

â€œHe was a bright spot in the lives of all who knew him. His loss will leave such a big hole in our lives that it takes our breath away. We ask that you please respect our privacy and join us in honoring his memory.â€

TLC, meanwhile, told Page Six, â€œWe are devastated to hear of the tragic loss of Garrison Brown. We extend our deepest sympathies and heartfelt condolences to the Brown family at this difficult time.â€

Warren Braithwaite

Warren Braithwaite, the partner of Nicole Murphy, passed away after a battle with cancer.

On March 2, close friends of the actor took to social media to mourn his passing, according to screenshots obtained by the Neighborhood Talk.

Michael Culver

â€œStar Warsâ€ actor Michael Culver died on Feb. 27. He was 85.

He had a brief role in â€œEpisode V â€“ The Empire Strikes Backâ€ as Capt. Lorth Needa.

Culverâ€™s cause of death was not immediately announced, though he reportedly had been in poor health for years.

Richard Lewis

Richard Lewis has died. He was 76.

The â€œCurb Your Enthusiasmâ€ star and legendary comic passed away in his Los Angeles home Feb. 27 after suffering a heart attack, his publicist, Jeff Abraham, confirmed to Deadline.

According to the rep, Lewis had been living with Parkinsonâ€™s disease, which the comic revealed in April 2023.

â€œHis wife, Joyce Lapinsky, thanks everyone for all the love, friendship and support and asks for privacy at this time,â€ Abraham said in a statement.

Thomas Kingston

Thomas Kingston, the ex of Pippa Middleton, died on Feb. 25 at age 45.

The financier was reportedly found dead at an address in Gloucestershire, England, and emergency services were called to the residence shortly after.

â€œIt is with the deepest sorrow that we announce the death of Thomas Kingston, our beloved husband, son and brother,â€ read a statement from Thomasâ€™ wife, Lady Gabriella Kingston, Mr. Martin and Mrs. Jill Kingston, Mrs. Joanna Connolly and Mrs. Emma Murray.

â€œTom was an exceptional man who lit up the lives of all who knew him. His death has come as a great shock to the whole family, and we ask you to respect our privacy as we mourn his passing.â€

Chris Gauthier

â€œOnce Upon a Timeâ€ actor Chris Gauthier died on Feb. 23 following a â€œbrief illness,â€ his manager announced.

â€œAs a beloved Vancouver-based character actor, Chris shared his talents with so many of us both on television and in film. His loss is felt not just by his fans but by those of us who were lucky enough to know him more personally,â€ the agency shared in a statement.

Gauthier is survived by his wife, Erin, and his two sons, Ben and Sebastian.

Tony Ganios

Tony Ganios, best known for playing Meat in the 1981 sex comedy film â€œPorkyâ€™sâ€ and starring in several other fan-favorite flicks, died Feb. 18.

He died after undergoing surgery for a spinal infection, his longtime fiancÃ©e, Amanda Serrano-Ganios, revealed on X. The surgery was successful, but he suffered a fatal heart attack the following day as he was recovering in a New York hospital.

He was 64.

Cecilia Gentili

Cecilia Gentili, a transgender activist and â€œPoseâ€ star, died on Feb. 6 at the age of 52.

â€œOur beloved Cecilia Gentili passed away this morning to continue watching over us in spirit,â€ a statement shared to her Instagram read. â€œPlease be gentle with each other and love one another with ferocity.â€

Although the statement didnâ€™t reveal how the actress died, fans were reassured that there would be â€œmore updatesâ€ shared at a later date.

Along with her acting career, Gentili was also known for her advocacy for the LGBTQ+ community, sex workers and undocumented immigrants.

Toby Keith

Country music star Toby Keith passed away on Monday, Feb. 5, after a battle with stomach cancer, his team announced on social media. He was 62.

â€œHe fought his fight with grace and courage,â€ the statement read. â€œPlease respect the privacy of his family at this time.â€

The â€œRed Solo Cupâ€ crooner first announced his diagnosis in June 2022 after he already had undergone treatment for six months.

Carl Weathers

Carl Weathers died in his sleep on Feb 1, his family confirmed in a statement to Page Six. He was 76.

The actor was best known for his role as Apollo Creed in the first four â€œRockyâ€ films. He also starred in â€œHappy Gilmoreâ€ alongside Adam Sandler and in â€œThe Predatorâ€ alongside Arnold Schwarzanegger.

His relatives told Page Six of the â€œMandalorianâ€ alum, â€œCarl was an exceptional human being who lived an extraordinary life.â€

Hinton Battle

Broadway star Hinton Battle â€” who originated the role of the Scarecrow in â€œThe Wizâ€ â€” died on Jan. 29, his friend Debbie Allen confirmed. He was 67.

â€œToday I honor Hinton Battle, my dear friend who left us to dance and sing in Godâ€™s Ensemble last night,â€ the actress wrote on Instagram. â€œHe fought this battle to live and be creative impacting audiences and young people across the globe.

â€œLet us always hold him high in our hearts and in our mindâ€™s eye and forever speak his name.â€

Allen didnâ€™t reveal a cause of death for Battle.

Chita Rivera

Chita Rivera â€” the Tony Award-winning Broadway actress, singer and dancer â€” died Jan. 30. She was 91.

â€œIt is with immense personal sorrow that I announce the death of the beloved Broadway icon Chita Rivera. My dear friend of over 40 years was 91,â€ her rep, Merle Frimark, said in a statement to People.

Riveraâ€™s daughter, Lisa Mordente, said in her own statement that her mom died in New York â€œafter a brief illness.â€

Melanie Safka

Melanie Safka, who was best known for her 1970 hit song â€œLay Down (Candles in the Rain),â€ died on Jan. 23. She was 76.
